issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Opening this ticket to track issues with PV images failing to run/convert while using vmware and/or vmware within a multi-cluster+dual hypervisor topology. 
So far the case where this has been seen is:
1) register pv image in a multi-hypvisor/cluster topo. 
2) Attempt to run the image in the kvm cluster and second later within the vmware cluster
3) KVM instance goes to running, vmware instance fails to terminated state (as well as repeated future attempts to run this instance) with the following logged output...
{code}
                         | :1398810499230:StatefulMessageSet:::VM_STARTING:      <euca:platform>linux</euca:platform>
                          | :1398810499230:StatefulMessageSet:::VM_STARTING:      <euca:migrationStateName>none</euca:migrationStateName>
                          | :1398810499230:StatefulMessageSet:::VM_STARTING:      <euca:productCodes/>
                          | :1398810499230:StatefulMessageSet:::VM_STARTING:    </euca:item>
                          | :1398810499230:StatefulMessageSet:::VM_STARTING:  </euca:vms>
                          | :1398810499230:StatefulMessageSet:::VM_STARTING:</euca:VmRunResponseType>

        at org.mule.execution.ExceptionToMessagingExceptionExecutionInterceptor.execute(ExceptionToMessagingExceptionExecutionInterceptor.java:27)
        at org.mule.execution.MessageProcessorNotificationExecutionInterceptor.execute(MessageProcessorNotificationExecutionInterceptor.java:61)
        at org.mule.execution.MessageProcessorExecutionTemplate.execute(MessageProcessorExecutionTemplate.java:47)


{code}


Will be adding more info as I debug. At first glance I noticed this in the logs...

comments.body: The error log is not related to the vmware failure (it is recorded the first time imaging service launches workers; we should improve it).

Looks like there's an error shortly after/during the download of the bundle to the imager? 
 vmdk_convert_to_remote   | vmdk.c:725: You have requested access to an area of the virtual disk that is out of bounds

See workflow_failure log for broker output, and instance_runattempt log for clc/ws output. 
Thanks,
-M
There are several issues with vmware conversion and run right now. The multi-AZ set ups adds an extra complexity that is addressed in the EUCA-9269.
I believe I have a fix for this (in dev/dmitrii/vmware-waits). Just kicked off a test with it. Feel free to try it out if you like.
Registered and started a paravirtual image on vmware.
